description: From French, from Latin figulīna (“pottery”), from figulus. See figulate.

adjectives.description: figuline (comparative more figuline, superlative most figuline)

entries.meaning: (of clay) Suitable for making pottery; fictile.
Made of clay, as by the potter; said of vessels, ornamental figures, etc.
A piece of pottery decorated with representations of natural objects.
examples: Whose figulines and rustic wares / Scarce find him bread from day to day.
